abstract.text: Information about linguistic, cultural, and technological conventions for use in formatting data for presentation.
The language code that identifies this language.
The region used with this language.
The written script used by this language.
An alphabetical code associated with a language.
A type that represents a geographic region, for use in specifying a locale or language.
The written script used with a given language.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.
Encodes this value into the given encoder.
Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.
The hash value.
Creates a script from a BCP 47 identifier.
Creates an instance initialized to the given value.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.
Creates a script from a BCP 47 identifier as a string literal.
Creates an instance initialized to the given value.
The type used to initialize a script with an extended grapheme cluster literal.
The type used to initialize a script with a string literal.
The type used to initialize a script with a Unicode scalar literal.
